Reviews.Title: great product, great price!
Reviews.Author: Desert Gypsy "A Brooklyn Girl Out West"
Reviews.Content: I guess am a rarity in that I have very little need for a cell phone. I basically only need one for emergencies and some light use when I travel. I bought this phone for twenty dollars at Walmart; it came with ten dollars of phone usage credit so essentially I paid ten bucks for the actual phone.The plan I chose allows me to refill in fifteen dollar increments or more. For that I get charged two dollars for any full day I use the phone for a phone call;the calls for that 24 hour period are UNLIMITED.I get also get charged two cents for each text incoming or outgoing and that is separate from the phone calls.Verizon has been very reliable service wise and I never have trouble getting a signal. We had a blackout in my small town recently and it was such a relief to be able to have service when the landline cordless units were down.The only quibble I have with this phone is that if I activate the phone by adding fifteen dollars, often I'll have seven or eight dollars left on the account and that amount does NOT roll over at the end of thirty days. For me, it's a small price to pay though for the convenience factor and no contract.I think one of the better things about this phone is that even if you use it every day, at two dollars a day, the maximum charge is sixty dollars a month - no extra taxes, hidden fees, etc. You'll always know exactly how deep you are getting in with the bill since it shuts down the ability to make calls if you have reached the limit of how much money you've applied to the account. The same goes for texting; it simply deducts two cents for each text.A simple product, a simple calling plan - works for me.Very pleased with this purchase and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: easy breezy
Reviews.Author: Bettie cheek
Reviews.Content: my cell phone died and i dreaded getting another - but i went on line - did some 'research' got this phone, and after using explosives to get it out of the package !!? - found it to be simple to set up and change my old verizon pay-as-you-go number- did it via customer service - I am 72 and i would say less than savvy about most technology - don't like trying to figure it out-  but this was easy - and so far phone set up easy with simple functions -probably more than i will use - but so far so good -- oh yes - i got a sexy little cover as well on amazon !! --bright colors so i can find it in my purse-- Oh and it was very inexpensive--what else do you want? yayyy amazon and verizon

Reviews.Title: ehh
Reviews.Author: Mostlee (Cleric) "Everquest fan"
Reviews.Content: It is what it is.  I bought one of these at a local discount store (20 bucks) when I was having big trouble getting through short phone calls and texts.  I had no bars 80 percent of the time and have since learned it may have been the work of an illegal repeater, but I digress.  Since I have no land line, I rely heavily on cell phone use and I needed something reliable to handle whatever would normally come my way.As a phone, it's great, although it takes getting used to if your downgrading from an android.  I programed in my frequent contacts, but couldn't find a way to assign a ringtone to specific contacts.  I attribute that to my impatience and/or lack of knowledge of the phone.What little I found of sounds or ringtones would be difficult at best to use.  Normally, you would pick a sound/ringtone you would like and the phone would play a sample for you.  The Gusto didn't do that.  Each ringtone has a number or a brief description and I had no way of testing it unless I asked someone to call me, in which case, that would eat away at what few minutes I had.As for the signal, good and clear and reliable.  Texts went out MUCH quicker than with slowski Sprint 3G network!  I liked the signal strength so much with this phone that I even considered upping the experiment to give Verizon a try with a contract.  Quick research, however indicated otherwise.  I know you can't get something for nothing, but I'm really not willing to pay as much as Verizon expects you to pay for a 4G, let alone a 3G phone.  The billing structure seems high to me.  Some reviews of service paint a dismal picture as well and that I won't get into.  Besides, most of these plans end up with totals pretty much the same as others.  Except for Virgin Mobile and their older model phones.  Some, not that much older.Anyway,  If I only needed this as a phone, I would say it's a keeper.  As for texting, it's tedious using the alpha keys to spell it out.  Brings back memories of when I started my cell phone adventure with Cingular.  Phone: good, Text: poor, extras: poor.  Cost (at a local store): good.  P.S.  If not used constantly, battery holds a charge very well.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG U360 VERIZON PREPAID
Reviews.Author: buttons1
Reviews.Content: OTHER PHONES I COULD NOT GET A SIGNAL MOST OF THE TIME, BUT WITH THIS PHONE I HAVE A SIGNAL ALL THE TIME. HAS MANY FEATURES THAT I ADORE. WISH I HAD IT YEARS AGO. I GOT THE PHONE PROMPTLY FROM AMAZON WHEN ORDERED. DO NOT BE AFRAID TO PURCHASE THIS PHONE.

Reviews.Title: Good product!
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.  Verizon has $50 per month - unlimited voice/text plan; no need to worry about phone bills/usage.  The phone works great!

Reviews.Title: Pay Go Solution
Reviews.Author: Owen P. Epstein "owene"
Reviews.Content: I needed a pay-go solution that specifically was Verizon CDMA.  I bought this phone and it is cheep and good quality.

Reviews.Title: Poor product features
Reviews.Author: Thomas Stover
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as my option with the autoclub phone service which runs through Verizon. This review is for the Samsung U360 phone only .... not the service.I hated my previous cell phone where I was constantly changing operating features whenever I would accidentally touch one of the buttons on the side of the phone .... which was almost every time I answered it. This phone is a better in that regard ... but not perfect. Fair.This phone has no ability to down-load photos onto my computer .... so it means I won't be using that feature. Unacceptable.The charging jack, which looks like a micro-USB connector but isn't, is difficult to open and looks like it will break off at any time. Poor.The phone can't be used when the battery runs down and you plug it in to your charger. Poor.The battery cover seems excessively difficult for me to remove and re-install. Poor.The menu features seem to be organized such that you're required to skip over unimportant features to get to important ones. Poor.The ability to add contacts is unintuitive and requires too many steps.  Poor.My first new phone died within a week. It was replaced free but the failure is a bad omen. Poor.Battery life at "idle" seems to last for days. Good.I think it is often hard to understand the callers' voices. Poor.The keyboard is far less than ideal. It is difficult to move your selection bar up and down. There doesn't seem to be a delete key so it can be difficult to correct typing errors. Fair.It DOES work but I wish I had bought a different phone.

Reviews.Title: Beware!
Reviews.Author: Staci
Reviews.Content: I bought the prepaid phone because I didn't use my cell phone much before when I was on the plan and I was wasting more than I was using.  I got the prepaid plan thinking it was nice because I would only pay as I use.  I have to admit I do like this part about it.  For me, that is what I was looking for.  However; shortly after getting the phone, I kept getting calls from companies asking for an Anthony.  I am not Anthony and I don't know anyone by that name.  So, they recycle the #'s.  The problem with this is I am charged $1.99 each day a call is made to or from my phone.  It is just a 1 time fee, so if I get 5 calls, it is just $1.99 for the first call and all others are free.  I don't feel this is my fault since the company decided to recyle the #'s.  So I called verizon and asked about getting my money back.  The first time this happened, the customer service rep, had no problem refunding my money.  Fast forward to today.  I have received 2 calls within 2 days of each other asking for Anthony again.  So, I have been billed $3.98 because of the recycled #.  I have advised the company they have the wrong # twice and that unless they want to start refunding my money for the call to my cell phone, they need to remove my #.  So I called verizon up again and asked for the money back.  I ended up having to get the supervisor involved who told me they will do it this time but in the future, they will not as this is not their fault.  REALLY???!!!!!  They chose to recycle the #'s, so it certainly isn't my fault.  So, just be cautious.  They said they could change my # but have no guarantee it won't happen again.  They also told me I could pay for the $50 plan and have unlimited access.  If I wanted to do that, I would've stuck to my old plan.  Not very good customer service at all and they weren't even compasionate about my needs.  If it continues to happen, I will be done with them and maybe look elsewhere.  I would not recommend going with them since they have the I don't care attitude.  If it happens again, they will be reported to the Better Business Bureau as this is not the way to run a business!  I wish I could've rated them a 0 star!

Reviews.Title: Cheapest way to port your Verizon number to Google
Reviews.Author: Sapphie Q. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I find this phone the cheapest way to port your Verizon number to Google Voice.  Just buy this cheap phone and switch your Verizon landline phone to this wireless phone.  Within 48 hours, the phone will be activated with the landline number.  Then start pay Google to port this same number to Google Voice.  Voila, your phone number is ported.  Simple.  Cheap.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: tony
Reviews.Content: Good,good,I like this vey much. Small, beautiful and good shape. I use it very smothly. And it has a very cheap price.

Reviews.Title: Great voice activated dialing!
Reviews.Author: Duffer98 "Duffer98"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my sight impaired mother who can not read her address book. The voice activated dialing works very well for her.

Reviews.Title: Durable, Long Battery Life + Clear Calls
Reviews.Author: R. Savini
Reviews.Content: I have bounced around on prepaid for several years. I had another service with an android phone and when I moved cross country it barely worked. It dropped calls, lost signal, dead spots etc. I know that Verizon's coverage is unmatched, and decided to go back to them via prepaid. $50 unlimited really is great from Vz, considering I still remember back when I was on a Verizon contract with the same style device paying $120! Android was fun a first, however, I did not use the apps and the extras hardly at all. I mainly make calls and send texts. I went with this phone because it was ultra cheap (fifteen bucks at WM; considering it comes with ten bucks free, its a five dollar phone!) and this was a good way for me to try out the Verizon prepaid with little investment. This phone is basic, but its durable and dependable. It has a nice body style with a matte grey, brushed finish. It does not feel cheap and plasticy like other lower end prepaids. The buttons are very large, and there is a shortcut key to messages and voicemail. Texting is tedious with the keypad after using swipe/touch however it gets the job done. The menu icons are large and look older, and prepaid-ish. Where this phone shines is call quality, which is clear as a bell. Stellar signal, no dropped calls or dead spots etc. Also the battery life is amazing. It lasts ages, like a week at least. I think for the price and the Verizon service its a great deal, and overall for a basic flip phone I think its really nice. I think someone older who like large buttons, or someone who mainly wants voice/text would be very happy to own this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Phone
Reviews.Author: jcarvers
Reviews.Content: I puchased this so I wouldn't need to take my Blackberry with me on vacation.  I was surprised by how easy to use and intuative this phone is, and the features that it has including the camera, the ability to set multiple alarms, and a easy to use tip calculator.  This makes a very good backup phone.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Prepaid Phone
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. McDonald
Reviews.Content: Was given as a gift.  So don't have personal knowledge of its working.  Individual simply loves it though.  The fact she can communicate again is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Dusty
Reviews.Content: This phone is good for people like me that just want a phone period  I just use it when I'm away from home.  The battery on it lasts along time.  I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung phone
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: It's just a phone.  The price was right.  I would recommend it to my family members if they were looking for a pnone.

Reviews.Title: I couldn't get it activated
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Jill Janus
Reviews.Content: After two days of calls and web searches through the Verizon maze I finally reached a person, no small feat with Verizon, who told me that phone had not been unlocked at the point of purchase and I had to return it to the sender.After this experience I would not buy from this seller again and never would buy a phone that uses Verizon. I was actually saved from Verizon misery which I have heard of from others but didn't believe what a mess Verizon wireless is.

Reviews.Title: Complete ripoff
Reviews.Author: V. Peters "Brewbum"
Reviews.Content: Good luck getting through to a human. Takes about an hr.You must keep adding funds no matter how much is left. In my case $140. They may roll over funds for a year but they must be used or Verizon steals your money. You could have hundreds in account and still have to add.You will not get a refund only a shafting. Complete and utter ripoff from a company that has been holding your money. Multiply a million accounts by an average prepaid balance and you can imagine how much money they control not you.Try finding any way to cancel online, doesn't exist.

Reviews.Title: Cell phone
Reviews.Author: Just me.
Reviews.Content: It's a nice little phone, not fancy, but if you just want the basics, it works fine.  And it's a flip top.

Reviews.Title: Delighted
Reviews.Author: DELIGHTED
Reviews.Content: I like the feel on it in my hands.  Easy to use and looks great and is easy to use and compact

Reviews.Title: Updated model
Reviews.Author: John Backes
Reviews.Content: It is the updated model to the one I dunked in the water, so it works just about the same with a few enhancements.

Reviews.Title: Not using this as a phone, but......
Reviews.Author: J-Man
Reviews.Content: ....as a charging 'dock' for the extra batteries that I purchased so that I always have a fresh one handy. My local Verizon store wanted $80 (approx.) for a portable charging station for my phone (they don't make a stand alone battery charger for this model) so this is a far better and less expenxive option.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Philip G. Hamilton "pguyham"
Reviews.Content: Adequate for a cell phone at the price.  It does the job, but weak antenna. Also, battery life is inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap!
Reviews.Author: Latoya
Reviews.Content: The phone is constanty shutting off and dont hold a charge. I need another phone because this is npt cutting it!

Reviews.Title: No contract but I can't use all my minutes... but I still love it.
Reviews.Author: T. Morris "On The High Desert"
Reviews.Content: I'd had Alltell for about 3 years because it was the only signal I could get out here in the desert. My plan was simple... add 10 bucks every 2-months and get charged 10 cents for every minute used. I never use any minutes but since I was dumping the useless 35 bucks a month basic land-line plan with Qwest I thought I still should have a phone for emergencies and all was fine until along came Verizon. To be fair, they let me continue with the same plan even though I had a braded Alltell phone. Late last year, they sent me a text message that they were no longer going to service former Alltell customes, or their phones, but I could switch my account over to a Verizon branded phone within the next 30-days. Off to Best Buy and they matched the 9 buck price Wallyworld was offering so I was all set. Stopped by the Verizon store and I was number 30 in line so I left and called from home, the transition was easy but the plan changed to 20 bucks every two months. I already had about 250 bucks on my account... that's money, not minutes, so I was unhappy to have to keep adding more money for minutes I'd never use. If you don't add by the time they state you will lose all your money. I said I was going to cancel so they wavered and gave me a full year before I would have to add again. I love the phone, Verizon has a super strong signal out here but I'll likely sell the phone with about 400 bucks in the account and buy another and just add 100 bucks for the entire year and be done with it. Hopefully, someone on eBay will give me 50 cents on the dollar. Have to give it 5-stars because the phone has all I need and it performs well... though I rarely turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Used Phone
Reviews.Author: mandy09
Reviews.Content: We got this phone about a week earlier than it said it would arrive and let me tell you it has been a great phone. There was no scratches or anything on it. The only downfall is that they wipe all the games off of the phone.

Reviews.Title: Present
Reviews.Author: Cat mommy "Cat Mommy"
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my hubby for a present. He's never had a cell phone before, and needed something basic. It has more 'bells and whistles' than he needs, but it's nice for him to finally have a phone of his own.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy customer
Reviews.Author: unhappycustomer
Reviews.Content: I have had my verizon prepaid phone for years, and never had a bit of trouble.Last year when I went to AZ for 2 months was a different story, after having prepaid around $100, I find out there is no prepaid service in the Mohave Valley, AZ, so when I got home expected to use up my minutes, but before I could do it, they were taken away, and when I was away from home and needed the phone too!  Well I bought more minutes, not learning my lesson, and they soon expired those minutes too!!I mainly use the phone for travel and or emergencys. It is a verizon wireless prepaid samsung phone.Well I am fed up with verizon and am switching to a competitor!!!  They will not restore my minutes, unless I buy more, and I am in no way in hell going to do that!!!

Reviews.Title: only works with verizon
Reviews.Author: r.w.
Reviews.Content: this phone only works with verizon prepay when i Purchased the phone I thought that it will work with pageplus but it turned out that it does not work.  So if you buy this phone you will have to pay high Verizon prepay charges

Reviews.Title: Not really an unlocked phone
Reviews.Author: Meilin
Reviews.Content: Did not know that it has an 8-month period that you are tied with limited choices, with Verizon only. So it is not really 'no contract' or unlock phone. It is certainly a 'locked' phone, just in different packaging.

Reviews.Title: Better use those minutes
Reviews.Author: William R. Schwartz
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for emergencies. All the prepaid minutes disappear before I can make a call. Phone hard to use

Reviews.Title: TOO EXPENSIVE!
Reviews.Author: chey
Reviews.Content: WHAT A RIP OFF! I only paid $15 for my gusto phone. even at the verizon store itself IT WAS NOT $59 FREAKING DOLLARS! Don't buy this item when you can get it for less at the actual company store! Works good but not THAT good

ProductInfo.Features:
Built-in digital camera
Multimedia messaging and text messaging
Internet access and browsing
Color display
1000-entry phone book
ProductInfo.Name: Verizon Wireless Prepaid - Samsung U360 No-contract Mobile Phone
